title: FTSE LIVE: Next sales rise; Santander struck by final PPI rush
text:
High street chain Next said sales picked up in October thanks to the falling temperatures driving customers into stores and to its website. The uplift meant sales across the quarter rose 2 per cent year-on-year.

Santander's UK business took a major hit from the PPI mis-selling scandal in the three months to September, as well as stiff competition, as profit before tax fell 43 per cent.

Mike Ashley has launched a public attack on the Competition and Markets Authority over its investigation into the takeover of Footasylum by JD Sports. The Sports Direct boss said assumptions made by officials about his retail empire are wrong.
